dict.string: Open and manage your Pinboard “toread” bookmarks

source ./workflowHandler.sh
IFS=$'\n'
if [[ ! -d "$(getDataDir)" ]]; then cat << EOF <?xml version='1.0'?><items> <item uid='Configure PinAdd Warning' valid='no'> <title>Your account isn't configured yet</title> <subtitle>run configurepinunread to set it</subtitle> <icon>icon.png</icon> </item> </items> EOF else unreaditems="$(getDataDir)/unreaditems.txt" user="$(getPref user 1)" secret="$(getPref secret 1)"
if [[ -z $(find "${unreaditems}" -mmin -5) ]] || [[ ! -f "${unreaditems}" ]] ; then curl --silent "https://feeds.pinboard.in/json/secret:${secret}/u:${user}/toread/" | python -mjson.tool | perl -pe 's/^\s+|\s+$//' | grep "^\"d\":\|^\"u\":" | perl -pe 's/\n//; print "\n" unless 1 == $. || /^"u":/' | perl -pe 's/^"d": | "u": |"//g' | perl -MHTML::Entities -CS -pe '$_ = encode_entities($_, "&<")' > "${unreaditems}" fi
echo "<?xml version='1.0'?><items>" for item in $(grep -in ".*{query}.*" "${unreaditems}"); do line="$(echo ${item} | sed 's/:.*//')" title="$(echo ${item} | sed 's/.*:\(.*\),.*/\1/')" url="$(echo ${item} | sed 's/.*,//')" echo "<item uuid='${line}' arg='${line}' valid='yes'>" echo "<title>${title}</title>" echo "<subtitle>${url}</subtitle>" echo "<icon>icon.png</icon>" echo "</item>" done echo "</items>" fi
Open and manage your Pinboard “toread” bookmarks
your-api-token your-preferred-action (see the “Readme” info for more details)

source ./workflowHandler.sh
token="$(cut -d " " -f1 <(echo "{query}"))" action="$(cut -d " " -f2 <(echo "{query}"))"
user=$(echo "${token}" | sed 's/:.*//') secret=$(curl --silent "https://api.pinboard.in/v1/user/secret/?auth_token=${token}" | grep 'result' | sed 's/<result>\(.*\)<\/result>/\1/')
setPref user "${user}" 1 setPref token "${token}" 1 setPref secret "${secret}" 1 setPref action "${action}" 1

Before using this workflow, you need to configure it with your Pinboard account by running “configurepinunread” followed by your api token and your preferred action.
You can get the API token of you Pinboard account by visiting https://pinboard.in/settings/password
Your preferred action may be one of delete, archive, or keep “Delete” will remove the bookmark from your account, after you act (open or copy the link) on it; “archive” will mark the bookmark as read; “keep” will leave it untouched.
An example configuration would be configurepinadd username:HSJWJK2HHSKI14QPDOIK delete
